contextId.information: an idiomatic expression for coming together to worship the Lord Jesus (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: in the name of our Lord Jesus

contextId.information: "Because everything I have just told you is true, this is what you need to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

This is an idiom by which Paul may mean that he became a Christian much later than the other apostles. Or perhaps he means that, unlike the other apostles, he did not witness Jesus' three-year-long ministry. AT: "someone who missed the experiences of the others" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: a child born at the wrong time

contextId.information: Kings who won wars would put their feet on the necks of those whom they had defeated. AT: "until God has completely destroyed all of Christ's enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: until he has put all his enemies under his feet

contextId.information: Kings who won wars would put their feet on the necks of those whom they had defeated. AT: "God has completely destroyed all of Christ's enemies." See how "put ... under his feet" is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:1co:15:24|15:25]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: he has put everything under his feet
